paragraphs.prompt: write a title for an AI generated script adaptation of Philip K. Dick's book Ubik. do not use the word Ubik. do not use quotation marks.
paragraphs.text: write a title for an AI generated script adaptation of Philip K. Dick's book Ubik. do not use the word Ubik. do not use quotation marks.

choose one type of product: home or beauty or auto or office or lifestyle or fashion or health.
write a short advertisement for that product, called Ubik. three sentences long.

INT. RUNICTER ASSOCIATES OFFICE - DAY

Joe Chip sits at his desk, waiting. Ahead of him, the door opens and Patricia Conley enters, smoldering and brooding.

JOE CHIP
(referring to Patricia)
You made good time, Mrs. Jackson. You had less time than anybody else.

PATRICIA CONLEY
(sand-colored lady)
Some of you I know.

GLEN RUNICTER
(rising from his chair)
Please find a seat and make yourselves comfortable.

Everyone finds a seat, settling in and getting ready for the meeting.

GLEN RUNICTER
(indicating Patricia)
You, Miss Dorn, Mr. Chip, and I chose you first because of your work with S. Dole Melipone.

EDIE DORN
(wispy and shy)
Thank you, Mr. Runciter. It's good to be a part of this new undertaking.

GLEN RUNICTER
(looking at his documents)
Which one of you is Al Hammond?

AL HAMMOND
(points to himself)
I'm Al Hammond.

GLEN RUNICTER
(reading Al Hammond's file)
You rate highest among our anti-precogs. How many of the rest of you are anti-precog?

Three people raise their hands.

GLEN RUNICTER
(to the group)
The four of you will get a great bloop out of meeting and working with G. G. Ashwood's most recent discovery. Miss Conley, would you describe it to us?

Patricia is about to respond when suddenly, Glen Runciter finds himself standing in front of a shop window on Fifth Avenue.

choose one device between the door or shower or newspaper or telephone or doorbell or radio. write four lines of spoken dialog between JOE CHIP and an automatic, coin-operated version of that device. It is reluctant to serve him because he has no money. format as a screenplay. four lines of dialog maximum.

GLEN RUNICTER
(startled)
What am I doing here? And how long have I been wandering around window-shopping when I should be in my office?

He tries to remember but realizes that his memory is failing him.

GLEN RUNICTER
(dazed)
Everything I built up... it's gone.
